data.text: Comfortable and Durable Bicycle Handlebar Tape Wrap?

Any recommendations for a comfortable but very durable handlebar tape? Looking for tapes that can handle 10k kms a year. Not interested in weird combinations involving shellac n cloth and so on. Just stuff I can order online. Thanks!

I use this on my commuter and it holds up well. Thick and crude, but durable. No pretense of finery calf skin leather and whatnot. https://s.lazada.sg/s.053mw
Check out 2 Pcs Soft Bicycle Handlebar Grip Tape Wrap...at 28% off!$5.76 only!Get it on Lazada now!
s.lazada.sg
data.author: Pinhole Cam

data.text: I have something similar to that on one bike and it's incredibly durable but not very comfortable. How is the comfort?
data.author: Ivan McAvinchey

data.text: Wolftooth Supple Gravel is very plushy and comfortable, but i went through it in about 10k km. Not wearing gloves might help with durability. Silca Nastro Cuscino is less plushy, but more durable. Have it for a while now, and so far so good
data.author: Andrius Popovas

data.text: Actually, I am using that Silca tape right now. Holes within 7k kms.
data.author: Wai Sing Lee

data.text: oh no.. i was hoping it is more durable than wolftooth.. you also use no-slip gloves or similar? i assumed that was the reason for the rub-through the tape.
data.author: Andrius Popovas

data.text: I am using thin road gloves...the palms are simply cloth I think. Not leather or plastic.
data.author: Wai Sing Lee

data.text: ok, good to know. if i will rub through the wraps, next time i will use a double-tape - inner layer of something plushy like one of the two i mentioned, and second - either leather or something similarly durable
data.author: Andrius Popovas

data.text: The Brooks Cambium bar tape was also a bit of a disappointment but it frays into a soft fuzzy look. The Silca looks like a gash.
data.author: Wai Sing Lee

data.text: Wiggle lifeline double wrapped. Itâ€™s brilliant
data.author: Stuart Haystead

data.text: There's this very cheap Chinese hexagonal pattern bar tape that I put on my touring bike in 2018 and it's still going strong. You can get it on AliExpress or Lazada/Shopee if you are in SE Asia, I see on Lazada Singapore for $6. It's quite thick, 3mm IIRC and the hexagonal pattern makes it sort of grippy. Only negative is it gets stained from sweat (goes sort of white) but you can just wipe it off. It certainly surpassed my expectations. https://www.lazada.sg/products/gloryworld-1-set-elastic-eva-bar-tape-comfortable-honeycomb-design-handlebar-tape-for-road-bike-i2108704322.html I have some Zipp CX tape that I bought at the same time that is meant to be super comfortable and was planning on putting on after this stuff but this stuff has lasted longer than I expected. On my best bike which I never ride I have Lizard Skins 3.2mm, it's extremely comfy but everyone tells me it falls apart. It hasn't in my case but I don't ride the bike. I've had Fizik Performance 3mm on the bike I ride most for the last almost three years, about 20,000km. It's actually on the second set of bars as the first was wrecked in a crash. It's totally ratty looking at this stage and I do need to replace it but it was fine 10,000km in. It's comfortable, looks very good, only issue is it's not tacky/grippy. No issue if you wear gloves and I don't and it's not even an issue then, but I do like the more tactile grip from some of the other stuff. I think the Zipp CX will have this if I put that on. The other thing I use is the Fizik Gel 2 stuff. Of all the gel stuff, the Fizik 2 specifically is the best shape, it's more spread out and fits more naturally.
data.author: Ivan McAvinchey

data.text: Salsa gel cork is amazingly durable and comfortable. Still using original tape on tandem front and back after 65,000 miles! Had to replace handlebars but tape is still going!
data.author: Barbara Hart

data.text: I second the recommendation for cork tape. I've tried a variety of different brands of cork tape including salsa and cinelli and haven't found particularly significant differences between any of them. Cork tape feels good with and without gloves, reasonably grippy... I've used a variety of different types of tape as well as wrapped bars with just about everything else... I've got 3 bikes with drop bars and all 3 have cork. If cork tape gets dirty if gets marked - washing doesn't matter because it's staying marked. Thus black cork.
data.author: Mike Krasovec

data.text: I should add that the Salsa gel cork tape has lasted 13 years and 65,000 miles.
data.author: Barbara Hart

data.text: Why not change regularly. A specialist told me when not well cleaned, via the handlebar you can pick up "la tourista" :-(
data.author: Hendrik J Roks

data.text: I was hoping to avoid changing yearly.
data.author: Wai Sing Lee

data.text: clean it regularly to avoid intestindiseases.
data.author: Hendrik J Roks

data.text: Well, I have been riding for a few decades now with no issues of that sort. Whew!
data.author: Wai Sing Lee
